After that, the next tasks should be getting approval and packaging the items securely, they should be done in parallel.  When packaging the items securely is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: printing invoice, attaching the shipping label to the packaging.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the next tasks should be arranging the delivery, loading items into the delivery vehicle and examining your other orders for delivery overlaps, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then sending a confirmation email to the customer should be done.  The process is now completed.

Once all pre-tasks are executed then the next tasks should be arranging the delivery, loading items into the delivery vehicle and checking your other orders for delivery overlaps, they should be done in parallel. After all pre-tasks are completed, then a confirmation email should be sent to the customer. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the order fulfillment process. It begins when you confirm that payment has been received.  Once confirming that payment has been received occurs, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: recording which products were taken from storage, requesting the ordered products from your inventory and performing quality checks.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the process is split into 2 parallel branches: packaging the items securely and measuring products.  After measuring products, one or more of the following paths should be executed: attaching the shipping label to the packaging, getting approval.  After getting approval, printing packing slip should be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then arranging the delivery needs to be done.  When arranging the delivery is completed, sending a confirmation email to the customer should be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description describes the order fulfillment process, which begins when you confirm that payment has been received. Once confirming that payment has been received, the process is divided into three parallel branches: recording which products were removed from storage, requesting the ordered products from your inventory and performing quality checks. Once all pre-tasks are executed then the process is split into 2 parallel branches : packing items securely and weighing products. After evaluating the products, one or more of the following paths should be followed : attaching the shipping label to the packaging and obtaining approval. The customer should send a confirmation email when the delivery is completed. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the order fulfillment process. It begins when you confirm that payment has been received.  When confirming that payment has been received is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: checking that the products are in stock, recording which products were taken from storage.  Afterwards, printing invoice should be done.  When printing invoice is completed, the next tasks should be loading items into the delivery vehicle and arranging the delivery, they should be done in parallel.  After loading items into the delivery vehicle, you need to examine your other orders for delivery overlaps. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then sending a confirmation email to the customer needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the order fulfillment process, when payment is confirmed. The things should be done in parallel. After loading items into the delivery vehicle, you must inspect your other orders for delivery overlaps. Once all pre-tasks are completed, the client needs to send a confirmation email. The process is now complete.

txt1: The following text is about the order fulfillment process. It begins when you record order details.  Once recording order details occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: recording which products were taken from storage, requesting the ordered products from your inventory, performing quality checks.  After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: getting approval, printing packing slip, attaching the shipping label to the packaging.  After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: loading items into the delivery vehicle, arranging the delivery.  When loading items into the delivery vehicle is completed, examining your other orders for delivery overlaps needs to be done.  After that, sending a confirmation email to the customer needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the order fulfillment process, it starts when you record order details. Once recording order details occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: recording which products were taken from storage, requesting the ordered products from your inventory and performing quality checks. After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: obtaining approval, printing packing slip, attaching the shipping label to the packaging. After that one or more of the following paths should be executed: loading items into the delivery vehicle, the arrangement of delivery. If loading items into the delivery truck is completed, it needs to examine your other orders for delivery overlaps. After that, a confirmation email to the customer needs to be sent out. The process is now completed.
